page.title: 19The Hill House
page.content: At the back of Hythe is an old private house which is falling to bits. This house has now been bought. There are five flats and six to seven rooms in each flat. This house used to belong to the Mackeston Brewery family. At the back of the house were some stables for horses; there was also a rose garden, herbs and grape vine in the green house. The property is surrounded by a Kentish ragstone wall. In the late 1960's and early 70's the house became a haven for young people. A few of the young people there tried to make the house nice and look after it but more and more people who were just 'passing through' started to use the place and vandalise it. This increased until there was no lead on the roof and the house started to decline because of the leaks in the roof.
